title: Framework-Based Mathematics Education to Overcome Collaborative Learning Assessment Barriers and Strengthen Problem-Solving Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience in using online learning tools
context.additional_context: Process leveraging PBL and activity-based pedagogy in smartphone-centric limited tech environments to address collaborative learning challenges and enhance problem-solving abilities

learning_goals: Learners can concretely explain group role distribution and collaboration strategies through PBL-based tasks
Learners can analyze math problems linked to real-world contexts and propose step-by-step solutions
Learners can use the LMS feedback system to self-assess their collaborative competencies and develop improvement plans
Learners can evaluate group activities with ≥80% satisfaction in fairness and efficiency using peer and instructor assessment tools

resources: PBL (Project-Based Learning) Task Templates and Assessment Rubrics
Collaborative Tools (Mobile Versions of Google Docs, Padlet, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
